pr_title: Analyze table fails for tables with struct columns

timeline.message:
Allow struct and map types in metastore column statistics

This commit removes the primitive requirement check and allows
struct and map types. This  was causing ANALYZE to fail
on tables with struct columns.

timeline.bodyText: this can just be if, as we have a sure return in the top if condition
timeline.author: bhhari
bhhari

timeline.bodyText: It looks like we only return an empty stats object now. I'm curious if we will be filling up the actual stats for structs and maps? How does the analyze result look like now with this change? Does it just leave that part empty? Is it possible to attach a printout of the result of it here?
timeline.author: yingsu00

replies.bodyText:
yes, that's correct we only return an empty stats right now since this is a fix for issue #14494. Here's a example of the output with and without this fix
presto:sj_test> select * from test;
     a      | b | c 
------------+---+---
 {b=1, c=2} | 3 | a 
(1 row)

without this change:
presto:sj_test> analyze test;
ANALYZE: 1 row

Query 20200515_162351_00021_y4gxt, FAILED, 2 nodes
Splits: 11 total, 11 done (100.00%)
0:00 [1 rows, 450B] [5 rows/s, 2.5KB/s]

Query 20200515_162351_00021_y4gxt failed: unsupported type: struct<b:int,c:int>

with this change:
presto:sj_test> analyze test;
ANALYZE: 1 row

Query 20200515_161538_00024_84q6a, FINISHED, 3 nodes
Splits: 11 total, 11 done (100.00%)
0:00 [1 rows, 452B] [10 rows/s, 4.8KB/s]
replies.author: sujay-jain

replies.bodyText:
I agree with @yingsu00  here. I can't tell if the hive metastore accepts column stats for struct types (for the non type specific fields), but if it does and we have the stats here, I think you should create a proper stats object here with those things set
Then you can test what happened by running "show stats" after running "analyze"
replies.author: rschlussel

replies.bodyText: @sujay-jain @yingsu00 @rschlussel It seems like ANALYZE statement never collected statistics for complex types, hence, fixing ANALYZE to not fail and produce empty statistics is a reasonable change. We may want to create an issue to add support for collecting stats for complex types, but priority of this would not be high and this can be handled separately at some future time.
replies.author: mbasmanova

replies.bodyText: Sure, but this just seems like such a quick thing to test out that I feel like it makes sense to try it now
replies.author: rschlussel

replies.bodyText: Also @sujay-jain  can you show the show stats output for the current implementation.  Just to confirm the behavior is the same.
replies.author: rschlussel

replies.bodyText: Thanks @sujay-jain . I'm ok with collecting the actual stats in a separate task/issue.
replies.author: yingsu00
sujay-jain

replies.bodyText:
Here's an output for analyze and show stats with my current change
presto:sj_test> select * from test;
     a      | b | c 
------------+---+---
 {b=1, c=2} | 3 | a 
(1 row)

presto:sj_test> analyze test;
ANALYZE: 1 row

Query 20200519_055255_00001_xtxwu, FINISHED, 1 node
Splits: 35 total, 35 done (100.00%)
0:01 [1 rows, 464B] [0 rows/s, 392B/s]

presto:sj_test> show stats for test;
 column_name | data_size | distinct_values_count | nulls_fraction | row_count | low_value | high_value 
-------------+-----------+-----------------------+----------------+-----------+-----------+------------
 a           | NULL      | NULL                  | NULL           | NULL      | NULL      | NULL       
 b           | NULL      |                   1.0 |            0.0 | NULL      | 3         | 3          
 c           |       1.0 |                   1.0 |            0.0 | NULL      | NULL      | NULL       
 NULL        | NULL      | NULL                  | NULL           |       1.0 | NULL      | NULL       
(4 rows)

Query 20200519_055302_00002_xtxwu, FINISHED, 1 node
Splits: 1 total, 1 done (100.00%)
0:00 [0 rows, 0B] [0 rows/s, 0B/s]
replies.author: sujay-jain

replies.bodyText: @sujay-jain nevermind then.  It was just an opportunisitic suggestion if it was easy.
replies.author: rschlussel

timeline.message:
Allow struct and map types in metastore column statistics

This commit removes the primitive requirement check and allows
struct and map types. This  was causing ANALYZE to fail
on tables with struct columns.

timeline.bodyText: @sujay-jain LIST type needs to be handled as well, right? Otherwise ANALYZE will fail on tables with columns of array/list type.
timeline.author: mbasmanova

replies.bodyText: maybe just make this an else to make sure we aren't missing anything else. I don't see a reason we need to throw an unsupported type exception for anything if we can return null stats.
replies.author: rschlussel

timeline.bodyText: @sujay-jain Would you also add end-to-end test to TestHiveTableStatistics?
timeline.author: mbasmanova

timeline.message:
Filter out non primitive columns when creating metastore column statictics

This commit filters out columns of non primitive types
which was causing ANALYZE to fail on tables with struct columns.
